Fields.DialogueText: KAAAPPPIIITAAAANNN!
What is it, darling?
*giggles* Aww, you're making me blush!

Fields.MenuText: Shucks. Here I thought you were equally as excited to see me.
Again?!
How urgent is it?

Fields.DialogueText: If we go into port, I'll be excited!
Da! I don't know when the last time was, but it's been far too long!
This is a very important mission. Without it I think I'll die.
Right then, what's so important that you need it now?
I need milk!
You just got milk.

Fields.MenuText: This isn't torture...
I suppose it is torture seeing you frustrated like this.

Fields.DialogueText: What if you were out of beer, Kapitan, then what?
So we are going now?
*ALARM*
We can leave for port after this battle.
@BATTLE
We need to go into port.
I'm out again. You can't torture me like this, Kapitan.
I'm so hungry!
We're not out of food, are we?
We are, and I'm starving!
Officer!
Yes, Kapitan?
What is our status on food? Are we out?
Plenty of tinned food, Kapitan.
See, we have plenty of food.
I can't eat any of that stuff! It's too bland.

Fields.MenuText: Why did you lie?
Why can't you eat normal food?
Candy doesn't constitute actual food.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not lying! I am starving and we are out of real food.
It's disgusting, soggy canned stuff. No flavor at all. The bread is tasteless.
With that attitude it's not.
PLLEEEEAASSSEE?
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
We have milk, we have milk!
We have MIIILK!
Here is your milk, First Comrade.
That's... that's all of it?
Milk is being rationed out at the moment, First Comrade.
How can you expect me to make that last? That won't make much toffee at all.
*SOB*

Fields.MenuText: Why did you make her cry?
Officer, you're dismissed!
Why can't life be easy?

Fields.DialogueText: This was the greatest quantity of milk that I could obtain, Kapitan.
I'll see myself out, Kapitan.
It beats being bored, Kapitan.
*ALARM*
I'll go ready the crew.
@BATTLE
Kapitan, help!
There's not enough milk here to make any toffee! Hmph!
There are other sweet things that don't require milk.
Give me an example, Kapitan.

Fields.MenuText: Bananas are sweet.
Berries are sweet.
What about chocolate?

Fields.DialogueText: Bananas are good, but they don't have the creamy, rich texture that toffee does.
Berries are too tart for me.
Chocolate melts too easily. I can't keep it stowed in my top if it's melting all the time.
I think we have some tinned pie filling.
Hmmm, let me try that.
Maybe if I put some cream on these berries...
Don't waste the milk!
I forgot! I think all the best things in life have milk in them.
*ALARM*
There's no milk in this battle. Therefore we can infer that it is not the best thing in life.
I... you're not wrong, S-3.
@BATTLE
Uhh...

Fields.MenuText: The battles?
The lack of milk?
The claustrophobia?

Fields.DialogueText: Nyet, not the battles. They are fun when I can land a hit.
DA! It's the lack of milk! I'm dying without it.
I think this place is very cozy.
Just hunker down. Not having milk isn't the end of the world.
What if we got a little goat?
This, again?

Fields.MenuText: I'll think about it.
I thought we already discussed this. Why are you bringing it up again?

Fields.DialogueText: Just imagine! We won't have to keep going into port for milk.
Last time I brought it up, your answer was that we would discuss it later.
*ALARM*
We'll talk about it later.
It's starting to sound like a broken record in here, Kapitan.
@BATTLE
I don't know how much more I can take of this!
It's much smaller and more practical to keep than a cow. Think about it, Kapitan.
*CLANK*
What's all this noise? What are you trying to do?
Hello, Kapitain! I've decided that we don't have enough room in these quarters.
What are you trying to do?
I'm demolishing the galley.
Why? That was a perfectly fine kitchen.
It took up too much room. Not enough room for what the crew wants to do. What the crew NEEDS. Their needs come first, Kapitan.
That's fine, but what are their needs?
They need more room.
For? You're circumventing the question.

Fields.MenuText: Why do they need more room? What are they doing, ballet?
Good, I was getting claustrophobic in here.
There goes my galley!

Fields.DialogueText: Why not? Ballet is fun, Kapitan!
I'm glad you agree with my plan!
Galleys are impractical. They cause messy dishes, and who wants to deal with that?
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Hmm, something smells fishy around here.
I'm just happy to have more open space.
For exercise, to move around.
Hey, what's that on the wall?
It's a hole!
Kapitan, what's wrong? Your face looks so grumpy.
There's a hole in the wall.

Fields.MenuText: How about fixing it now?
It can be fixed later. You're just too cute to upset.
I want to watch you sweat while you work for... science. Yeah, that's it, science.

Fields.DialogueText: Aww, that's no fun. I'll do it later.
Kapitan, you're making me blush!
You might not like the smell afterward, and we'd have to go into port for me to shower. Now that I think about it, we can also get some milk while we are in port!
*ALARM*
See, Kapitan, there's no time to fix it now anyway.
Did you plan this all along?
Ew, of course not. That is no fun.
@BATTLE
Whew, now that it's over with...
Hey, what's this? It is... wrapping paper? Covering the hole with wrapping paper?!
Surprise! Do you like it?
That's not exactly fixing the hole...
It's more fun this way. Look at this pretty color - it's so shiny!
Oh, that... it happens when you move things around. Don't worry, I'll fix it later.
*CRASH*
It sounded like someone was scuttling the ship! There's still construction going on?

Fields.MenuText: There goes the needed storage space...
It's not as if anyone is organized around here anyway.
I'll miss being able to make a meal.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't fret, Kapitan, we can still keep things on the floor. I like seeing where everything is anyway.
Organization is such a subjective term.
With no galley, it's less work! No longer will sailors have to waste time cleaning dishes.
Ooo, what is that rolling across the floor?
It's a vodka bottle.
Vodka? Why do people drink this stuff? It's not sweet at all.
Some people mix it with cream and cocoa powder for a sweeter drink.
That's similar to that eggnog drink! But without raw eggs.
I might have some milk left over from the officer's trip.
That might not be a good idea.
Decisions, decisions. Do I want to save what milk I have left, or mix the sweet drink you mentioned?
Hee-hee, I'm removing the cabinets. This room is cramped, and taking out the cabinets will give us more room.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
What's so funny?
Hee-hee, that vodka and cream drink you suggested is magical!
You're walking a bit funny...
WEEE!

Fields.MenuText: Clearly you've had too much to drink.
You should drink more. It's obvious that you've lost your sea legs.
Give me that mug!

Fields.DialogueText: Nyet, I've never heard *hic* such an expression.
Will drinking more help me find them?
Don't take it away from me, please!
Who could imagine that alcohol that smells like floor cleaner is capable of tasting sweet?
Looks like we'll have to go back into port to get more milk.
*ALARM*
You're clearly not ready for battle.
Zzzz...
HEY! Don't go to sleep! I need you for the battle!
WHAT?! Nyet, I was just resting my eyes. *giggle*
@BATTLE
Oh! The ship is tilting... Are we diving right now?
URRGG, my head!
I think you have a hangover.

Fields.MenuText: No, that's what happens when you drink too much.
You need to drink more water.
You'd better will all of your estate to me.

Fields.DialogueText: I thought hangovers were supposed to be funny? Why does everyone make them out to be comical? I'm in AGONY!
Ew, water? I hate the taste of water. Can't I have juice?
I knew it! I am dying!
You're not dying. Just drink more liquids.
Only if it's juice - do we have any juice? Make sure it's sweet and not tart.
*ALARM*
URG, my HEAD! Are those alarms always that loud?
I'll get you some aspirin. You're not going to like the battle.
@BATTLE
Nyet, I think I'm dying. It wasn't vodka. Someone tried to poison me with floor cleaner.
Look at the additional space we have, Kapitan!

Fields.MenuText: I love it!
But now I don't have a galley.
Not like anyone cleaned up in the kitchen to begin with.

Fields.DialogueText: I love it, too! I hated doing dishes. I'd rather spend my time doing something fun.
Who needs a galley? Now we have more time to do fun things and less time being burdened with depressing work.
You see? The answer was staring us in the face all along!
I don't blame anyone for not cleaning. It wasn't fun. Whoever thinks that cleaning is fun must be an odd person.
Aren't you going to paint the walls where the cabinets were?
Da! I was hoping for a bright yellow color!
Are you sure that's allowed?
Urg, not again! I wish the military wasn't so strict with their boring, depressing colors.
*ALARM*
Maybe I can land a critical hit or two - that will cheer us all up!
@BATTLE
Without the galley, we can keep the area clean and none of the sailors have to waste time cleaning dishes.
What was that noise?

Fields.MenuText: The ability to store food was removed along with the galley.
I don't have any food.
Ask one of the sailors.

Fields.DialogueText: Let's just go to port and get something to eat.
Then let's head to port. Aren't you feeling the hunger pangs?
I tried to ask for a bite, but they didn't want to share.
Are you beginning to question the practicality of removing the galley?
Never! I'd rather be hungry for a little while than clean dishes. Cleaning is no fun at all.
Now we have to go into port even more often due to lack of storage.
I don't mind that! Going into town is fun, especially when it's a new town I've never been to.
*ALARM*
What about battle?
It is fun only when I get to win!
@BATTLE
It's my tummy. I'm so hungry... Don't we have any food in here?
*CLANK*
What's happening? I thought we needed more space?
Kapitan! I was just building something. It's... uh... a table.
That looks like an odd table to me.

Fields.MenuText: This looks more like a corral than a table.
What kind of table uses sides that look like an animal stable?
This looks like a fine table to me!

Fields.DialogueText: These tables are very popular in the Soviet Union... out in the remote villages which you might not have ever heard the names of.
Um... only the most practical tables are built this way.
It will bring everyone so much joy to have this table here.
Are you sure this is a, what did you call it... a recreation room?
Da! We can all have a lot of fun in here.
What's that over there? Is that hay?!
Oh, look at that, over there, Kapitan...
Ha, you can't distract me. I think it's hay.
*ALARM*
We have enemies coming!
@BATTLE
You think it's odd? These are very trendy in the Soviet Union.
It's here! My MILK!
Hmmm... that's an awfully large crate for milk.
Well, I was able to get a lot of it.
Is there something moving around in there?
Oh, it must be some bottles of milk rolling around.
Is... is that a hoof?
Uhh? Oh, no! That's a milk cap!
*ALARM*
Got to go, Kapitan!
@BATTLE
Hey, where did that crate go?

Fields.MenuText: Where did all the milk go?
Why are you so quick to remove that crate? Since when are you so proactive about cleaning?
Come clean. What's going on here?!

Fields.DialogueText: I used it to make toffee! Don't ask, because I am not willing to share.
You know, Kapitan... a dirty vessel isn't any fun...
Cleaning? That's no fun!
The milk crate? I took the milk out of it already. We don't need that big crate taking up room in here.
I think I heard a scream! Someone must be in trouble!
I think it's coming from inside here...
S-3, is that you?
Are you doing all right? I'm coming in!
Hey, that's a goat!
You found us, Kapitan!
S-3? And a goat?! I knew it. That wasn't a milk crate, that was a goat crate.

Fields.MenuText: I knew something was up.
So that wasn't a Soviet table after all... it was a goat corral.
I give up!

Fields.DialogueText: Don't blame me, Kapitan! If only there was more milk available in the world, nobody would have to resort to this.
I did what I needed to do. The crew needs real food.
Yay!!

Fields.MenuText: You could never be in trouble with me. You are far too lovely.
I don't have time for this. We'll talk about it later.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh! I knew there was a reason why I liked you, Kapitan...
I don't want to be in trouble! It's only a teensy goat.
*ALARM*
Even if you were in trouble, there's no time for punishment now...
HOORAY! I'm off the gulag road.
@BATTLE
You have it all wrong, Kapitan. That WAS a milk crate... but the milk wasn't done being processed yet.
I'm not in trouble then, am I?
Why did you keep that goat a secret for so long?

Fields.MenuText: You could never get in trouble with me, really.
I wish you had told me about your plans rather than hiding them.
At this point, I didn't know what I was expecting.

Fields.DialogueText: Really?!
Much easier to ask for forgiveness than to ask for permission, Kapitan.
You should be grateful I only got a goat. A goat is much more reasonable than a cow and ever more so than a bear.
What kind of goat is it?
It's a LaMancha goat! They are from America, and noted for being a smaller dairy breed.
How much hay do they have to eat in a day?
Hmmm, that's a good question.
Better not let her go hungry.
I'll make sure to give Lenta plenty of food, don't worry!
Lenta?
That's the goat's name.
*ALARM*
I guess you can't get rid of her if you've named her so soon.
@BATTLE
I didn't want to get in trouble...
Captain, I have an issue to report.
What is it, Sailor?
It appears that the laces of my shoes have been chewed off.
Hmmm...
What are we looking at? Something fun?
Depends... are chewed laces fun?
My shoes...

Fields.MenuText: No, this poor sailor did because you don't keep food in the submarine any longer.
Are you hiding MORE goats in this submarine?
I did, out of sheer boredom.

Fields.DialogueText: Then this sailor should go into port! Maybe they can pick me up something sweet when they are in town.
I haven't, Kapitan! Would I ever lie to you?
You did? Oh, wait... is that sarcasm?
Of course Lenta chewed up the laces. Now this sailor needs new shoes.
*ALARM*
I guess this means we need to go into port! I could use a breath of fresh air.
@BATTLE
Meep! Did Lenta do that?
Captain, have you seen my kerchief?
No I haven't seen it.
Drat. I was hoping you'd know where it went to.
I have an idea... S-3!
Da, Kapitan, what is it that you need?
My kerchief is missing, First Comrade.
Do you mean the scarf? I saw Lenta eating a scarf earlier.

Fields.MenuText: This goat is causing too much trouble.
You should be able to keep our goat penned better.
It was funny. It sure beats being bored.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll try to keep her penned up, Kapitan.
I'll try my best to not let it happen again, Kapitan.
Tee-hee! I thought it was also funny... but I feel bad for the poor sailor.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
I suppose the mystery is solved then...
Your goat keeps getting into trouble.
It's not her fault. She can't help it. Just look at her.
*BAA!*

Fields.MenuText: You're much cuter than she is.
Goats are not cute.
You have a point. She is cute.

Fields.DialogueText: Tee-hee! I don't know what to do with all these compliments, Kapitan.
But they are! Look at her tiny ears! Just look at them!
See, I knew you would come around. You are just the best, Kapitan.
Keep her out of trouble!
But sometimes it can be fun when she gets into trouble!
Think of the crew.
I'll do my best.
*ALARM*
*BAAA!*
Now would be a good time to pen her.
On my way, Kapitan.
@BATTLE
See, isn't she the cutest?
You seem cheerful.
I'm on my way to milk Lenta. I am very excited for the fresh milk.
How do you think it will affect the taste of your toffee?

Fields.MenuText: Oh, just a hunch that the taste is going to be different.
Goat's milk tastes different than cow's milk. I wonder how the taste will affect the toffee.
I don't know what I am saying! I think I'm just inebriated by the exuberance of my own verbosity.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't see why the taste should be any different.
Goat's milk has a different taste? What is the taste like? I hope it is sweet.
Those were a lot of big words in what you just said. Big words are not very fun.
Have you seen my pail?
I saw a pail in the control room.
Thanks, Kapitan!
She's so cute.
*ALARM*
*BAAAA!*
AHHH!
Whoops, sorry about that. She must have startled you, Kapitan!
@BATTLE
What do you mean?
Lenta?!? LEEENNNTTAAA?!
Did she get out again?

Fields.MenuText: You should have kept her penned up better.
That battle was very scary.
LEEENNTTAAA!

Fields.DialogueText: I penned her, and I even tied the gate. I think the jarring from the last battle loosened the gate so she could get out.
I don't blame her for hiding.
LENNTAA! You are making me worried!
Be patient and she'll turn up. I don't think she could have gotten very far.
I hope one of the crew didn't decide to eat her!
How? There's nowhere to cook a goat. Not since you axed the galley.
Oh, that's right. I KNEW there was a reason I removed that galley!
@BATTLE
That last battle must have scared her, Kapitan.
*ALARM*
I still can't find her, Kapitan.
We're in a tube, so how far can she really go?
KAAAPIITAAANN, I am very worried...

Fields.MenuText: LEEENTAAAA!
Don't cry. It breaks my heart.
You're very beautiful when you cry.

Fields.DialogueText: I hope we can find her soon!
It breaks my heart that she could be trapped somewhere.
This is no time for compliments, Kapitan. This is not beautiful. This is a travesty!
*ALARM*
Maybe she will appear after the battle.
I hope so, Kapitan.
I don't know what I'd do if I found a desiccated goat body.
I think we'd smell it before we saw it.
@BATTLE
*SOB*
Say, sailor, you haven't seen a goat around here, have you?
I haven't seen Comrade S-3's goat. Sorry, Kapitan.
Keep an eye, or an ear, out for me, would you?
Aye aye, Kapitan.
LEEENNTTTAAAA??
I still haven't seen her, nor have any of the crew.

Fields.MenuText: Lenta, where are you? I know you need to come out to eat sometime soon.
All this crew and not one of them can find a goat?
She's probably in my bed right now, eating my secret stash of cookies.

Fields.DialogueText: She must be very hungry.
Goes to show you how smart a goat can be.
You keep a secret stash of cookies in your bed? Where? I was just in there.
*ALARM*
I hope she turns up soon!
@BATTLE
Kapitan, her missing is making me sick with grief. I thought it would be fun to have a goat, but now my mood has been gravely dampened.
Is... is that a goat I hear?
Hey, how did you end up in the engine room... on top of the engine...
*BAAA!*
Lenta!!
*BAAA!*
I was worried sick! I thought I would never see you again!
Where was she, Kapitan?
She was in the engine room, stuck on top of the motor casing, and she couldn't get down.
You must be so hungry!
I am feeling a bit hungry.
I was talking to Lenta.
Oh, but I am hungry, too.

Fields.MenuText: How do you know how goats work?
I hate the taste of goat milk, YUCK.
I'm just happy you found her.

Fields.DialogueText: You don't?
Less for you is more for me, then.
It feels so nice to be happy again! I don't know how long I could stand being miserable. I think I nearly died from heartbreak.
Now to FINALLY enjoy some fresh milk. There is light at the end of this tunnel. It is all sparkles and rainbows from here on out with my endless supply of toffee.
Remember last time you indulged in toffee.
I regret nothing!
@BATTLE
Maybe in a bit we'll have some fresh goat milk, Kapitan. I am sure she needs to be milked. Her udders look swollen.
*ALARM*
UURRRGGGG! *groan*
What's wrong?

Fields.MenuText: Well, that solves if you like the taste of goat milk or not. I hope you don't get a food aversion.
Glad I swore off the stuff years ago.
You have a distinct lack of self-control.

Fields.DialogueText: It was good, and it was nice to have cream. Remember, the best things in life have milk in them.
I would like to hear the stories! Not now, though - sometime when I'm not in the middle of dying.
I can't help that I like to have fun. It's in my nature.
I think I need that medicine you gave me last time.
The seltzer?
I think that's the one.
I'll get you a glass of water.
YUCK! You know I can't stand the taste of that stuff..
Goat milk?
UUUHHHH!
Juice then...
YAY! I knew you were a keeper for a reason.
A keeper?
*ALARM*
Hurry with my medicine, Kapitan!
@BATTLE
I'm quite happy right now. I'm sailing high in the clouds.
You got over your belly ache fast.
Spasibo, Kapitan.
Here, I want to repay you... with a kiss.
Oh? Oh, my...
Close your eyes... and... *kiss!*
*BAAA!*
AHHH!
*giggles* That was great!
I knew there was a reason I liked you, Kapitan!
I think I drank too much milk! I think I have another belly ache.
